Reviews.Title: “OldMill stay”
Reviews.Author: Bryan B
Reviews.Content: Our daughter will be married at the Old Mill later this year and this year my wife and I celebrated our 50th wedding anniversary so we decided to spend a couple of nights in one of their suites - to sort of check it out. Overall it was a pleasant experience, the building has a certain level of charm. We booked a 'your way get away weekend package' which included a $200 gift certificate.and upgraded to a suite .The accomodation was very good and staff helpful and courteous.TV viewing in the lounge part of the suite not the best with seating off to the sides of the TV. Good for reading though. We had beautful walks along the Humber River .If you are looking for more things to do then this area will not cut it. But we really did enjoy the peace and solitude. We ate in the Old Mill restaurant - free continental breakfast was just right. We chose the Terrace in the dining room - not a big fan of live music for an eating environment!.I think if we were staying longer than the two days - the choices on the dinner menu could have been a challenge. What we had was very tasty and well presented.For our anniversary dinner the dining room manager had placed unlabelled flowers on our table (Previously arranged by our daughter). It was a complete surprise to us - in fact when we sat down we asked our server if we were at the wrong table. The manager came over and explained. One hitch with the dinner which ultimately worked out fine - I asked questions on the two pasta dishes on the menu and ended up being served the one I had not ordered. Our server was most apologetic and wanted to bring me the other one - but with my wife sitting there waiting to start her meal I declined. The pasta dish was delicious so all was well. We had planned to have the Sunday brunch with family members to celebrate our anniversary and we tried to reserve a table to guarantee seating only to be told reservations only for a minimum of 8. The dining room desk staff told us not to worry seating would be no problem for early March. I had some concerns with this approach, so when we went for our anniversary dinner I spoke with the Dining Room Manager and explained the situation and that we were staying at the Inn. He arranged a reserved table for us. If he had not done so my plan B was to book for 8 and not use the spare seating - should not have to do this. It worked out fine. It was so busy next day we would not have gotten a table.This review could have been totally different - alls well that ends well. Overall rating then - very good. It is far from cheap. I did not mention parking - a construction site is part of the parking lot!!! We went by bus and subway to avoid any issues. Old Mill are expanding I think so when it is complete parking could be a real challenge. For those coming along this summer there could be real issues - dont know where all the construction materials and traffic will fit. I guess we will find out at our daughter's wedding in Oct. 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Old World ambience with mod cons”
Reviews.Author: Typenut
Reviews.Content: There's a reason why the Old Mill Inn is rated so highly in the list of hotels in Toronto -- it promises the "Wow Factor" and delivers it with elegance. My wife and I decided to celebrate our wedding anniversary with an overnight stay featuring the Old Mill's "Romance Package" and were impressed from check in to check out -- and with everything in between. Let's start with the check in: we asked for early check in and were advised to phone about availability on the morning we were to arrive. First pleasant surprise: we called at about 10am and were told, "Come in anytime -- your room is ready!" We live just outside Toronto and were able to check in by noon. Regular check in is, like most hotels, 4:00pm. An immediate four hour bonus! We also obtained a late check out to 1:00pm and thus had a 25 hour stay -- unlike the usual, short 20 hour "day." Unlike many hotels, parking is free with check in. Second pleasant surprise: when we asked if an upgrade was possible we were advised, "We've already upgraded you to a Luxury King Suite." And what an upgrade. The suite consisted of a large bedroom with super comfy bed and a view of the Humber River; a delightful sitting room with fireplace; a large, separate dining room with huge windows on three sides and seating for six; plus an elegant bathroom with two-person whirlpool tub, twin sinks, and a very modern glassed-in shower. Soft, easy-listening jazz was playing throughout the suite, and there were good sized (though rather out-of-date) TVs in both bedroom and sitting room. The Romance Package included a bottle of chilled Chardonnay, some delicious chocolate, and a supply of bubble bath for the Jacuzzi. The minibar was very well stocked and didn't seem quite as exorbitantly priced as some hotels. And there is an in-room safe. In the evening we had an excellent dinner in the hotel's dining room. This is classic dinner-dancing and usually features big band music. For a change of pace after dinner we walked along the hall to the Home Smith Bar where the superb jazz singer Heather Bambrick and her trio was playing. Altogether a wonderful and memorable evening. (Ask the bartender for a Royale Martini -- a delightful blend of vodka, champagne, and cassis.) The next morning we enjoyed a complimentary Continental breakfast in the bright and airy Terrace Room. A good variety of breads and pastries, fruit, sliced meats, smoked salmon, cereals, yogurts, and juices. And of course the obligatory bottomless cups of fresh-brewed coffee. After breakfast we enjoyed a walk through the hotel gardens and beside the river. The Old Mill is very supportive of jazz in Toronto and features top musicians at the weekend and many nights of the week. Check the hotel's Entertainment Calendar on their website. They also have a strong tie-in with JazzFM91, Toronto's great jazz radio station. Kudos to the excellent management and staff at The Old Mill Inn. They are doing it right. We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed, top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bijoux12
Reviews.Content: We purchased a voucher for our stay at the old mill through jaunt, we weren't sure what to expect- would be treated differently because we got such a cheap rate? but when we arrived, we were treated so exceptionally well. We were upgraded to their largest deluxe suite, it was the most beautiful hotel room that we have seen! The room was sparkling clean and beautifully decorated. It had a living room, dining room and a huge bathroom. The bed was even more comfortable that my own lol! To top it off they gave us a bottle of wine and some yummy chocolate. Anyhow, you can't go wrong with the old mill, their standards are so high and you will not be disappointed! We are definitely coming back this summer, thanks to the amazing staff that made our stay so special. You really won two customers for life.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Anne H
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms with fireplace, stereo system and jazzuci tub. Lots of pillows and quality linen.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely linens, jaquzzi tubs and great service from Eugene- thank you”
Reviews.Author: salsasuave
Reviews.Content: Loved my room when I was at the Old Mill for a training. The rooms are spacious, great mattresses and good quality pillows. Bathrooms are well appointed and internet is free for guest. When I had some questions regarding my bill, Eugene stepped in and took care everything. Thank you Eugene for your great customer service

Reviews.Title: “Charming, classing and well kept”
Reviews.Author: gmcnab
Reviews.Content: Despite the age of the inn, the rooms were very well kept. Yes, they were a bit older in style but remarkably clean and fresh. The service was very pleasant and all round a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: lorettaph
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to stay at the Old Mill last week for 4 nights in a luxury king suite. Previous reviews made us apprehensive, but the location is close to my sisters house and we had to stay close. On previous visits, we typically stayed at the Four Seasons in Yorkville or a similar hotel. The Old Mill will be our first choice for all future trips. Loved it here. Our room was unbelievable. Gorgeous. The restaurant and bar were great to have. I had the continental breakfast daily that is included in the room stay. My husband had an omelette on two mornings. That was the nicest looking plate. No complaints. If u can, have Sunday brunch here. The seafood station was quite a surprise, especially the fresh lobsters. For dessert we fell in love with the bread pudding and chocolate mousse. We also had lunch here on Monday. Did not expect as extensive a lunch as we had on Sunday, but boy was I wrong. There were even more choices. The only dinner we had was a late one where we opted to skip another buffet and instead ate a small meal in the bar area. Nice. By the fireplace. The grounds are beautiful here, even in March. The location is a good one, with a subway stop close by. Toronto has a great transportation system. The hotel concierge was quite helpful when we asked for weekend entertainment options. The front desk looked after our every need including our luggage. Wish we had stayed here on previous trips. Will b back. I expect it will b beautiful in spring and summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: palk
Reviews.Content: This was a great night away. Without asking, they upgraded us to a suite and it was very nice. We had all that was promised plus a living room. We went on a Wed night when there wasn't entertainment in the Bar ... very quiet. However, if you book on a Thurs night, they have very good jazz in the Homes Bar. The food is good in the Bar as well. All in all, a lovely experience. I also booked a massage in the Spa and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, but don't order room service.”
Reviews.Author: evsinger
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at The Old Mill Inn, despite some serious disappointments. We arrived in the afternoon for a couples massage, which was a great experience, and had afternoon tea in the restaurant. Tea was good, but quite expensive (>$60 for 2), considering the amount of food. We ordered room service for dinner and breakfast. Having seen great reviews for the restaurant, we had high expectations for the food, and were extremely disappointed. My wife had chicken fingers and fries - the fries were soggy, and chicken fingers were clearly frozen from a box. I had the butter chicken - chicken was dry, sauce watery. Dessert was mediocre at best. We ordered room service again for breakfast. Not as bad as dinner, but nothing special. Overall we spent over $700 for 1 night, 3 meals and a massage. The only part of the stay we truly felt was worth the money was the massage. When asked at checkout about the stay, we mentioned our issues, and were told to fill out a comment card. We didnt ask for anything, but no offer was made to make up for the poor food. We received an email from the hotel manager saying they had reviewed the comments and would be discussing with food services.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and quiet property but-”
Reviews.Author: Larissa D
Reviews.Content: We were told to ask for an upgrade upon arrival, the upgrade was meant to be for a suite. When we arrived to our room, although it was very nice, it was not a suite. TVs are very old fashioned and you only get very basic cable. Very expensive to watch movies. Breakfast had very little choice, although the smoked salmon was very good. Overall, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “A stay I will never forget!”
Reviews.Author: valynnc
Reviews.Content: When my husband & I decided to visit the Maya exhibit at the ROM for the long family day weekend, he suggested we stay at a hotel in the west end of the city. As a VIP member of Ontario's Finest Inns & Spas, I said "I know just the place" From the moment I made contact with Brad at the front desk, who was very pleasant & efficient, I knew I was in for something special. Our suite was probably the nicest suite I have ever stayed in and unfortunately, for any future visits, The Old Mill has set the standard to which I will compare. Everything was impeccably clean, tasteful, sumptuous linens, and a bathroom of my dreams. The bottle of wine and note welcoming us was a nice touch. We had a casual dinner at the Home Smith Lounge and met some nice people. They had a jazz ensemble playing live music (jazz is my favourite) which was awesome. To be quite honest, I didn't want to go home. We will definitely be back, perhaps in the fall. I imagine the autumn colours are beautiful in the Humber Valley. The proximity to the Bloor subway is perfect to scoot downtown, and with free parking at the Inn, this is a "no brainer". We are both from the west end of the city originally so we enjoyed the shops on Bloor near Royal York. Lovely bakery, green grocer etc. If I had to and I mean had to complain, hmmm....I can't! It was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great room but---”
Reviews.Author: tardylass
Reviews.Content: Four of us just stayed here in February. The room was very nice, large, comfortable and good service. However for such an expensive place the complimentary breakfast was below average. Not much selection and the table with the food was pushed back into the corner so only 1 to 2 people could get their food at a time. A la cart breakfast was at least $15-$25 each. You think they could have given a better breakfast with such an expensive room. Also no buffet on Sat. and if you stayed in the Inn for supper $100-$150 minimum they even charged a $10/person cover charge for the band. No pool. A little cheap on their part. Wouldn't stay again probably would rather try another nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Went for an office Party, great, but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Djgoldma
Reviews.Content: We had our office party here, around 200 people. The food was alright, could have used more seasoning, but it did come out hot, and everyone received it at the same time. The wait staff were very nice and accomodating. My only real complaint were some of the bartenders..some were incredibly rude, and seemed like they hated being there...other than that, great event, and venue.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, but don't go during wedding season!”
Reviews.Author: Bassoonjordan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used a "Wag Jag Jaunt" to get a great deal at The Old Mill for one night in September, 2011. It was a 'babymoon' for us (I was 6 months pregnant) and also my 30th birthday. The room we had was very nice, with a king-sized bed, whirlpool tub and a view... of the subway station. Ah well. The Wag Jag had also come with a voucher for dinner, and we chose to eat in the piano bar, as opposed to the main restaurant, which they said was busier, and thus louder. The menu was interesting, with a number of twists on pub food (grilled cheese with brie, etc). My husband and I enjoyed dinner, but when the entertainment started (jazz combo) we found it to be a little loud and moved into the back room where we could hear ourselves talk. The next day I had a massage in the spa, which was great! They even had someone who did pregnancy massages, which was especially worth it! While I had my massage, my husband explored the grounds and buildings at the Old Mill, and then he took me around afterwards. It was really neat to see all of the old-style buildings and rooms that have been restored to look like they would have a hundred or so years ago, and there were some neat garden areas that we also enjoyed... but... There were OVER 14 WEDDING-RELATED EVENTS GOING ON. Yes, 14. Everywhere we turned, there was another wedding party having photographs where we would have liked to wander, or take pictures, or hang out... When we explored the main building, almost every room was set up, or being set up for a wedding, bridal/baby shower, or other event. Which is fine, because we did choose to go on a weekend, but there really isn't anything else to do, or anywhere else to go if you're not part of a wedding. We were constantly turning around, trying to avoid being in someone else's wedding photos, and waiting our turn to take pictures in front of the fountain, etc. Don't get me wrong, the Old Mill is a great location in the middle of Toronto with some really picturesque spots, excellent staff and great rooms, but there really isn't much to do on site, and there's even less when they book 14 weddings on one weekend, to perhaps the detriment of the other paying guests.

Reviews.Title: “need to update furnitures , frames, carpet and pianos in the reception hall”
Reviews.Author: bravososa1812
Reviews.Content: We have booked the old Mill for a wedding reception. we thought this could be a nice elegant venue . We were initially excited with the atmosphere, the old setting and booked the hall for a wedding this year . However, when we are seriously checking the place to decorate for the upcoming wedding, we found out furnitures disgusting, in really bad condition and appearance . some furnitures are similar to old basement furnitures they are awful!!! Pianos in the hall are disgusting, with wood cracks, needs at least to give it some polish or restoration , a grand piano would be great to see in this place , not worn out, unpleasant appearance of pianos that you would not even dare to touch . antique furnitures need to be restored and refinish Mix and match of furnitures in the hall is unacceptable, they should get an interior decorator and update this place. Frames are cheap and needs to be replaced . We wanted to get a pianist for the hall but this piano is disgusting and the wood cracks are all over the piano. would rather have it covered than get someone to play this instrument. We are hoping they would get this updated before this summer of 2012 Unfortunately we can no longer back out as it is late and cannot refund the downpayment. Hope something will be done before the summer this year to make us proud of the venue for my son's wedding.

Reviews.Title: “"Home away from Home!"”
Reviews.Author: Pam M
Reviews.Content: Truly a pleasant experience, a home away from home. I travel frequently on business to all the provinces and this is my favorite spot. It has beautiful surroundings, clean and comfy beds with a team of friendly staff to make each stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a capital "S"”
Reviews.Author: Lawsyl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful clean rooms. Friendly, respectful and courteous staff. Delicious food. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “A Wow time!”
Reviews.Author: Linda L
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent and well appointed - fireplace added a romantic touch. Our dinner (Winterlicious) was very good. Accommodated a vegan dinner for one of us. Dancing with 'Graffiti Park' was an excellent bonus with our dinner. Management and staff were more than accommodating to our requirements. We would definitely recommend a dinner, dance evening and hotel stay based on our recent experience. The Old Mill has maintained its high standard of excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: flowersToronto
Reviews.Content: We recently celebrated my mother's 75 th birthday with diner and an overnite stay at the Old Mill. Our family members gathered from various parts of Ontario for this event and we booked a total of 8 rooms. Unfortunately we got off to bumpy start when reservations confirmed that our rooms had all been booked for the wrong date, but the hotel manager compensated us by upgrading 2 of the rooms with suites when we were forced to re-schedule the date. The suites were magnificent, very spacious, and comfortable. It was especially delightful to arrive at our rooms later in the evening and enjoy the benifits of their turn- down service, which included soft music, a lit fireplace, turned down sheets and chocolates on the pillows. The balance of our rooms were also very clean, spacious and comfortable. Another snag that we encontered was being advised when booking that there were no adjoining rooms. This was not the case, and one family member with small children was forced to split up for the nite after resigning to their explaination that adjacent rooms was the best that they could offer. Over the past 45 yrs or so my family has enjoyed countless diners and functions at the Old Mill, and although it was our first visit to the hotel, it will certainly not be our last. All 21 of us enjoyed it completely and it was an especially memorable celebration for my mother.

Reviews.Title: “More Beautiful Than I Imagined”
Reviews.Author: Mary Anne H
Reviews.Content: I bought a special for my husband as a Christmas Gift. It included a deluxe upgraded suite with chilled wine, chocolates, candles, house coats and slippers and turn down service at night included. The separate living room had a beautiful fireplace and lovely hardwood floors. The bathroom was huge with a jacuzzi tub and double sinks and lots of towels, and bubble bath. Every window we looked out had a view of trees and hills and a pathway. Bloor West Village was nearby so we could pick up some nice European pastries, cheese and meats. There was a nice 3 piece jazz group that played in the bar downstairs. Morning breakfast included all your juices, coffee, cheese, pastries and all kinds of breads and fresh fuit. Loved everything.

Reviews.Title: “excellence in every detail”
Reviews.Author: Ruth0845
Reviews.Content: Stayed over for the oldies dance. The service is great, very helpful, good wine selection in the bar, food was good, served hot and the hotel itself is just a charming place to be. I would recommend this a must try place.

Reviews.Title: “our visit to this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: gary c
Reviews.Content: I planned a surprise one-night stay at the inn for my wife. From the time we entered the lobby, we were treated like family. The staff are courteous, knowledgeable, and at all times, went out of their way to ensure we had a pleasant stay. The room, complete with fireplace and bar, was exceptional. We spent part of our time touring the buildings which exhibit a number of interesting paintings and artifacts. Prior to leaving, we enjoyed a wonderful breakfast

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: skendal
Reviews.Content: i live in north toronto and decided to surprise my husband w/a night out. i booked the old mill and was very happy with my decision. the grounds and hotel are beautiful. the neighbourhood was fun for us to explore. best of all is the bed. so comfortable, clean and tasteful. an overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “An impressive inn but they need to work on the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Glenn K
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly, the rooms are great, and the inn is a truly impressive building. My one and only issue is with their breakfast buffet. I have stayed there three times now and each time, there have been fruit flies buzzing around the buffet table. Last time, the fruit bowl had moldy fruit and overall, the buffet is unimpressive.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary to Remember”
Reviews.Author: Trisha68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used to celebrate our anniversary at the Old Mill every year since we got married there in 2001. After a five year absence we decided to return for our 10th year anniversary--we were not disappointed. We had a beautiful spacious suite and found a complimentary bottle of wine with a card congratulating us on our special day. All staff was courteous and attentive. We had a fabulous dinner! My only regret is that I didn't book a spa treatment in advance so I could enjoy all the great services the spa has to offer. I would not hesitate to recommend the Old Mill Inn for any occasion!

Reviews.Title: “Always wonderfull!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie F
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Old Mill & Spa many times and have never been disappointed. The surroundings are beautifull, the concierge and dining room staff are courteous and attentive and the rooms are just delightful. Out of numerous hotels we have stayed in, the beds are by far the most comfortable ever. Although, of course, the Inn has all the modern conveniences, because of it's old world charm and lush setting, while you're there, you can forget you're in the city and settle in to the very cozy warm atmosphere and relax! Food is great too - whether the sumptuous Sunday brunch or dinner - our favourite is the beef tenderloin - it really does cut like butter! Would highly recommend The Old Mill & Spa to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “NYE 2011”
Reviews.Author: LoungeLizardMMMMM
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the OMI&S. Just two comments re our particular suite: The interior of the sleeping / living area was dark, i.e. not enough lighting, even during daylight hours with the drapes fully open. Also, We would have liked more milk or coffee whitener. We found one each just not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to be said...Absolute perfection!!!”
Reviews.Author: CruiseWhere
Reviews.Content: Guest services...impeccable!!! Room.......absolutely fabulous!!! Dinner & Dancing.......remarkable!!!! Spa....wonderful!!!! Not a complaint to be had!!! Go and enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel in a great quiet part of town”
Reviews.Author: Primespinister
Reviews.Content: I got married at the Old Mill Inn and spa last summer. Their outdoor wedding garden is beautiful, and the outdoor patio/garden areas are lovely for pictures. The reception halls are equally gorgeous and the food and drinks were all delicious. We received so many compliments on the quality of the food. The restaurant in the Old Mill is a lovely place for a date, with great food and wine. The rooms are all very well decorated, and up to date. I was in several different rooms visiting friends, and they were all spacious and well laid out. Beds are very comfortable, and contribute to the overall relaxing nature of the Old Mill Inn. We stayed in one of the suites on the night of our wedding, and it was absolutely stunning. Certainly not cheap, but I'm pretty sure that our suite is bigger than our home. We did not want to leave! Service is exceptional, across the board. A classy establishment. I would highly recommend it to any out of town guests who want to stay somewhere nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Old Mill Inn. We stayed in the main inn in one of the suites. Fantastic! Beutifully decorated and well appointed. Had a very relaxing mini vacation, just the two of us. Could have had a dance party in the room - so much space! Had the dinner buffet that night. Great, attentive service. Plenty of selection on the buffet. Definately enjoyed our stay and will make it a point to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Old Mill Inn & Spa - November 26, 2011”
Reviews.Author: Tina L
Reviews.Content: Our group of 4 couples came to enjoy the final CHFI Saturday Night Oldies Dance and stay the night. We booked in July to ensure we had a room for each couple. The accommodations were fantastic and the staff were very welcoming and accommodating. I was pleased to find that they made a point of putting us all together in a row of rooms on the same floor which was nice for socializing with our group. The meal was good and restaurant service staff were great. We did miss the continental breakfast cut-off time of 10am and did not want to wait an hour to be seated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Inn with Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: Fabulash
Reviews.Content: We had a special function to attend in the area and chose the Old Mill Inn to stay at for the night of Nov. 27 - 28. They were offering a special "Fresh Start Sunday" rate of $189.00 for a Luxury King room including free parking, continental breakfast and late check-out. We have been to dinners, weddings, showers etc before at this beautiful Inn but have never stayed there before. Our room was really lovely with classic decor, tray ceiling, crown moulding, built-in fireplace, and TV above, built-in drawers and desk. The bathroom is big with a large jacuzzi tub, separate large shower, vanity with sink and separate room with toilet, another sink and even a telephone. We were on the 4th floor and had a great view of the Ravine. I also like the fact that you can open the windows and get fresh air into the room. We had requested earlier check-in at 2:00 pm and our room was ready when we arrived. We went to the hotel bar for a drink and appetizer before heading off for our special function at 4 pm. The Bar was quiet but the Inn restaurant was really busy and packed with Christmas parties and other special celebrations - apparently Sundays are their busiest days around this time of year. The continental breakfast the next morning included everything you would expect along with goumet cheeses and fresh fruit. We really enjoyed our stay and definitely would come again The only draw-back is that there is construction going on across the street. They are building a condo and the street is messy and noisy during the day. There really isn't much around the Inn to walk to other than the park. However there is the Old Mill subway (Bloor subway line) just up the street which you can take anywhere you need to go if you don't want to drive.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time at Old Mill Inn & Spa.”
Reviews.Author: DeniseVS
Reviews.Content: My review would be from the time we arrived until we left the service was great! One thing our last name is spelt .... Mr. & Mrs. L&D Van Sickle. We would love to return for another 2 night stay at the right price. Maybe with our 15 & 13 year old Daughter's as a family weekend!!! Thank you Denise Van Sickle

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: renee32
Reviews.Content: I went there for a sisters weekend getaway. The place is gorgeous, the rooms are beautiful. Luxurious beds. The spa is very memorable, the staff are very welcoming. The massage and facial was fabulous! Continental breakfast each morning was very filling and food great. I would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excessive in a great way.”
Reviews.Author: winequaffer
Reviews.Content: Rare for me is that I cannot find a single fault at this hotel. Service: the bar tender had closed the bar and reopened for us to enjoy a late nite ale... he stood by with nothing to do but wait for us... when we went to bed, he felt bad that we might have not have had a 2nd beer and offered us one for our bedrooms. We explained we didn't have any more Canadian money... so he bought us the beer himself!! Extraordinary!!! I mean we've been in the hotel for 45 minutes and feel like we're staying with friends. Rooms... wow is all I can say. not too big, not too small, elegant with large bathrooms. Breakfast... yeow... delicious buffet for me, my colleague ordered the big breakfast off the menu. Location - we are runners and 150 feet from the hotel door is a river park with walking + running trails... perfect. Parking was included so that saves a bundle instead of downtown Toronto. Location... it's only 10 minutes from the main highway so while it seems off the beaten path, it's not. Atmosphere... this place is a charming as it gets... need to return with the wife. Bravo Old Mill you deliver world class service I've only ever found at Relais and Chateau's.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway in the city”
Reviews.Author: Cherisse C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend at the Old Mill Inn over the Rememberance Day weekend. We had a wonderful time! The hotel is clean, comfortable and the food was excellent. The service was also superb--the front desk staff, the Peruvian and Bangladesh servers were so accomodating and Darvin(?) so friendly. My husand and I took the weekend trip to celebrate our anniversary. We live in Grand Cayman--a beautiful place of course, but we chose the Old Mill because of its quaint old world charm to experience something different from what we see here on an island. We are so glad we did. The train station around the corner was very convenient and we even enjoyed renting bicycles and riding around the city one day. We hope to return again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: JayneP676
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Old Mill many times. The rooms are always wonderful, very clean and well maintained. The spa is excellent and the entertainment lots of fun. The food and service is always excellent. The surrounding scenery and walking trails is a great way to spend a couple of hours relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Old British charm with all the amenities a person could want!”
Reviews.Author: arodKitchener
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, the staff go out of their way to help you and are courteous. The Inn makes you feel as if you are in the middle of nowhere-certainly not downtown toronto! The rooms have an old charm, but are all upgraded with things like jetted tubs and lovely carpets/bedding. My husband and I were there for a wedding & will absolutley be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay. But not wondeful price.”
Reviews.Author: Jason N
Reviews.Content: Staff and accommodations were wonderful but the price was hefty on the pocket book.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: DiscoverAndEnjoy
Reviews.Content: A beautiful heritage-type property tucked out of the city core. The rooms were delightful, the staff helpful, but I doubt I would stay there again. While it was lovely, I couldn't get past the feeling that I was in a seniors complex and I'm too young for that scene. For people with mobility challenges, the layout is unusual, corridors of the Old Mill lead to 'wrong turns' and there is construction across the street which is noisy. If you want to escape and have privacy this place is perfect. It's close to the airport and food on site is great. If, however, you want to be in the action the restaurants are a good 20 - 25 minute walk or you need to take your car. When you talk to people in the neighbourhood as you stroll around, they say 'there's nothing to do here'. So, it is a different place. Absolutely nothing wrong with the property at all - just a very specific type of guest experience - but not for me. Ideal for romance, weddings, and a tuck-away. But a little odd for my tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in pleasant location”
Reviews.Author: Wizak
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an interesting building in a good location in Toronto. It wasn't high rise (so I could walk to my room without an elevator) and there were local restaurants nearby. The subway is clue and its day to get into downtown Toronto without a car. Its also easy to drive downtown! The rooms were large and very comfortable with good facilities and big beds! The staff couldn't have been more helpful with all our enquiries and made our stay very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was so perfect!”
Reviews.Author: JAEMH
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place! First of all, the atmosphere. Very cosy and romantic. Secondly, the staff is extreme friendly, relaxt and professional. We travel the World and have quite some experience and therefore even more value the excellent service in the Old Mill. We had planned to celebrating my birthday but due to unforeseen circumstances we only arrived late in the evening. We had contacted hotel manager Vas Kolovos before for advice and were so pleased with the upgrade to a wonderful suite and a chocolate present in the bed. It really gave a lovely touch to the day. Thanks once more! But this is not all. The Old Inn serves a superb breakfast buffet with different muesli kinds, fresh home made pastryâ€™s, smoked salmon and cheese. The hotel is very convenient located in a very nice, residential neighbourhood, 25 minutes/37 CAD from the airport en 25 minutes/3 CAD by metro to the heart of town (and the station is around the block). There are also lovely walking and running tracks and with the in house Spa itâ€™s the place for a long weekend for gaining new energy. We did and left with fond memories. A place worth a special recommendation for both private as well as for business functions (I would not mind organising a seminar in the Old Mill) as really everything was perfect! Maybe only one suggestion; why not including wireless internet in your hotel rate (it's already available in the lobby and bar). Just make this extra step....;-)

Reviews.Title: “Romantic get away at the Old Mill Inn”
Reviews.Author: TravelChicToronto
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I needed some quality time together and booked an evening at the Old Mill Inn. We live just north of the city but felt we were transported to a quaint village in Europe. The Inn is beautiful, staff attentive and polite, warm glowing fireplaces, wing back chairs, cobblestone walls/exterior and lush gardens...it was a quick but well needed escape from our busy lives. We had a lovely meal and the wine selection while not extensive is still very good. We finished with dessert in our room and another bottle of wine, enjoyed the whirlpool tub then relaxed by the fire. It was the perfect romantic get away....now back to work.....dreaming of our next escape already!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Jmann191
Reviews.Content: Recently I attended a wedding at the old mill inn and spa. The location was amazing and well maintained. The hotel manager (Vas Kolovos) went above and beyond to help us to transport our luggage. She did an exceptional job along with All the staff

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venue for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: South Shields
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night here to attend a wedding and was sorry we couldn't stay longer. Thanks to a Becks Taxi driver, we arrived just in time to see the groom take his place in the chapel. Reception was very good to take luggage to our room and check us in fast. We didn't see our room till about 10.00pm. A beautiful room, very quiet and romantic. I didn't want to leave. I had a great sleep, Beds and duvets were so comfortable. Fireplace and music playing. We had to leave by 11.00am but not before I enjoyed a nice long soak in that big beautiful tub.I wish we could have stayed longer to enjoy it more. Will be on my list next time we go to Toronto. I must stay here longer. It reminder me of Lewes in England with all the beams and Tudor styling. A great place for a wedding! The service in the reception was second to none, the girls did an amazing job, as was the meal, oh, what a meal ......

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary and decided to spend an evenig at the Old Mill, we advised them of our anniversary and they presented us with a complementary bottle of wine. The rooms at the Mill are excellent very clean and well appointed the whole facility is very well maintained. We like the Mill because of the entertaiment they present on the weekends, this year we saw the Platters. They have a great dance floor and your dinner table is not very far from the floor with good visuals to the entertainment. Food itself was good and well presented, a little pricey but you expect this going in.

Reviews.Title: “Old Mill Inn and reception”
Reviews.Author: OrangeGem
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous venue. Beautifully appointed. Staff are excellent and really helpful BUT dismally inaccessible if your are mobility impaired. There should be a ramp at the least, going down the two flights of stairs from the chapel to the reception rooms for the aged and mobility impaired.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at the Old Mill & Spa”
Reviews.Author: Dianne H
Reviews.Content: Attended a wedding reception and it just couldn't have been more lovely. The charm of the buildings was just the best and I would compare our stay to the Millcroft accept on a much larger scale but the same ambiance. Will definitely encourage others to plan a getaway. My 92 year old aunt who was with us and living in Toronto wants to spend a week-end there sometime soon. I also suggested she use the Spa. Just a very relaxing setting. Staff bent over backwards to assist us in our needs for which we are very grateful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time in a real nice place”
Reviews.Author: pita58
Reviews.Content: Lovely place to spend the weekend. It was a rainy and windy weekend, but you don't feel the weather in the nice atmosphere of this nice hotel. The service is very good. We had a nice time at the hotel, the room was very nice, drink and light dinner at the bar , under the tunes of live jazz . Wonderful walks around the hotel. The area is spectacular. The residential area a little bit further at the Kingsways is a must see. I'll go back again and will explore all the area around. The wooded trails must be spectacular even in winter time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Corporate Experience”
Reviews.Author: Joyce C
Reviews.Content: We organized a one day corporate event at the Old Mill and an overnight stay for guests who were traveling. From the beginning to the end it was well organized, the staff were exceptionally helpful and the venue first class.

Reviews.Title: “European Luxury in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: LindaVToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: I've just arrived home after a one night stay at The Old Mill Inn and Spa. I didn't want to leave. I had purchased a Jaunt package for a King Room, breakfast and $100. gift card to spend at the Old Mill. I arrived at 10am to see if an early check in would be possible. I had been upgraded to a most beautiful King Suite and it was ready for me. The decor was very chic and upscale, the fireplace and large tub with jets were fantastic. I loved the high ceilings with floor to ceiling windows that opened. The room was spotless and the stereo system throughout was appreciated. I had lunch Mon and Tues on the gift card and stopped into the Flower/Gift Shop before I left and spent the balance from the card on a really beautiful purse. The autumn leaves on all the trees in the parklands and wooded trails surrounding the Inn were the icing on the cake. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Email just sent to Hotel - Would not recommend the Dining Room”
Reviews.Author: t0r0nt0chick
Reviews.Content: Hello, I stayed at the Old Mill for the first time on Oct. 8th to surprise my fiancÃ© for his birthday. Everything was great from the check in to the amazing room â€“ we were raving and having a great time. Unfortunately, our experience was ruined by our dinner in the dining room that night. I had made a reservation and our table was ready on time our server gave us a wine list, which we ordered from, we ordered our dinner and it was all downhill from there. I ordered the Halibut and my fiancÃ© ordered a trio of meat dish. Timing was a little slow on the food but when it arrived I was surprised that when taking a bite of my halibut it burnt my mouth! It was way overcooked and upon return of the server (an older German man) when I told him about my fish he just kind of shrugged and walked away. Needless to say I did not enjoy my meal. When my fiancÃ© cut into his â€œmedium rareâ€� steak he discovered it blue rare and could not eat it â€“ this wasnâ€™t discovered however at the same time as my fish. When we informed the server again about the steak he took it away and returned back to the table only to argue that it was the cut of meat and it was cooked properly. He could clearly tell we were not happy with our meals and asked the manger or Maitreâ€™D to come over. He only spoke to my fiancÃ©e and didnâ€™t even acknowledge me which I found very rude, especially because I paid the bill! At the end of this awful experience we were offered dessert on the house (which we were not going to order anyway). To top it all off we were charged an $15 admission fee each which we also had no idea about. At this point we knew no one really cared so I paid the bill and we left. It really is disappointing to us as we were considering The Old Mill as a wedding venue but after our experience in the dinning room we will never be eating there again. This message is intended for feedback as if no one tells anyone who actually cares, things will remain the same. Kind regards, Erin

Reviews.Title: “Living Social Package”
Reviews.Author: Josh D
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great staff, good food, and easy trip to heart of Toronto. This is a great hotel. My wife and I traveled on a Living Social package deal that was two nights with a few activities (biking, kayaking, dinner). The package was an incredible deal and, even better, we were never treated like we where lessor guests. I was extremely impressed by the service and the treatment we received. We had dinner in the Home Smith Bar which was very cozy, had live Jazz, and the food was very good. Beautiful park located steps away from the hotel for the nature lover and a few steps in the other direction is the subway station for the city lover. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and keep an eye out for another package deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great for business too”
Reviews.Author: JadepearlToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for a business meeting. Great meeting rooms, service and food. The guest rooms also luxurious, very comfy beds, free wi-fi and an electric fireplace. Lighting in rooms a little dark for working. Fitness room is in the basement and well equipped. The beautiful grounds and area great for walking and jogging.

Reviews.Title: “Once there it was great”
Reviews.Author: Ruby H
Reviews.Content: We had a hard time finding the front entrance and the cabbie dropped us off at the wrong entrance so that made it hard to get in. Wife using a walker so made it hard to circle the property. This was for our 18th Anniversary, and we definitely felt the warmth and charm helped us enjoy our special day. Seeing another couple get married at the same time was extra special. Once in it was great, a very nice room and fantastic dinner and breakfast. Definitely, will return.

Reviews.Title: “A nice quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: musicmansimpson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 1st anniversary because I had to work downtown early the next day. We were originally thinking that we would order room service and stay in for the evening, but the room service menu was quite disappointing. Not wanting to eat the buffet at the restaurant on Sunday evening, we just went downtown to eat. Breakfast the next morning was nothing special at the restaurant, but it was fine (and included in our rate). The hotel itself is beautiful;. We really enjoyed our room, which had windows on two walls. The hotel decor is lovely, the grounds immaculate, and the service very good. All in all, a great stay, and we'll be sure to be back. Considering average corporate hotels run the same rate, what's a quick trip down the subway to stay at this hidden gem?

Reviews.Title: “Fun Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: PamGurdHughes
Reviews.Content: My partner found a deal though Jaunt and we had dined at the restaurant before but never stayed over night. We arrived at noon on a Saturday and since the check-in was at 4:00 p.m., we had our baggage stored by the hotel. The parking was across from the hotel and the cost was included in the price of the room. The room was large with a king-size bed and seating area. It had an electric fireplace and Sony TV. The bathroom had a Jacuzzi, a large glass shower, and sink. There was a sliding door to the toilet and second sink. There was a safe in the closet. We had dinner in the dining room and it was excellent. Both my partner and I ordered the prime rib and it was cooked to our specifications. The wine selection was excellent and so was the dessert. There was a singer and band for those who wished to listen or dance. There was a $15.00 per person cover charge for that. Our evening at the restaurant was fun and the band ended at 11:00 p.m. which was the perfect time for us. Most of the people in the dining room were 40 years old and up. Our continental breakfast was included in the price of the room. We like to start our day with a bowl of fresh fruit and they had that at the buffet. The fruit tasted fresh and there was a good variety of fruit in the fruit salad. The only two areas for improvement would be that on Saturday, there was only one working elevator as the second one had over-heated due to the hotel being filled to its capacity. The second improvement would be to use brighter light bulbs in the lamps on the night tables to assist in reading at night. I would stay at the Old Mill and Spa again and I would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility but staff leave something to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Rachel M
Reviews.Content: Be very careful if you are a smoker and staying at this hotel. Make sure that you do not leave any evidence in your room (such as a nearly empty pack of cigarettes on the table) or you will be accused of smoking in your room and charged $ 200.00. If you have the same experience I had they will wait until you have already checked out of the hotel to charge your credit card. My partner and I stayed at the hotel for four nights and were accused of smoking in our room and then charged $200.00 four days after we checked out of the hotel. When we first learned of the charge we had not checked out yet. We talked to the front desk at the hotel, (since there was no manager in the hotel on the day we checked out), and after some discussion we were told that the charge was not going to be put through on our credit card. We then checked out of the hotel thinking the situation had been resolved, boy was I in for a big surprise! Four days after checking out the charge appeared on my credit card. When I contacted the hotel manager I was told all kinds of things that were never disclosed to me when we checked out of the hotel. When I quizzed the manager on why I was not told any of this information when I checked out she really didnâ€™t have an answer for me and just kept telling me she would use this experience as â€œfeedbackâ€� for her staff. They also do not respond to complaints from the Better Business Bureau. After finding out that they would not reverse the charges I filed a complaint with the BBB, they had two chances to respond to that complaint and did not file a response to either request. I have now had to resort to filing a disputed charge with Mastercard. My advice, if you have any problems while staying at this hotel make sure you get the resolution in writing from either the front desk or the manager. If you donâ€™t you may be in the same situation I am in, they will wait until you are 4000 miles away to charge you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot”
Reviews.Author: redheader1
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked through the doors, we were impressed. The staff was very accomodating and friendly at the front desk. Before our dinner reservation, we strolled the grounds. The only big disappointment was in the dining room. Our waitress, an older german lady, was terrible. She advised of no specials, i had to ask 3 times for a steak knife- which she responded: We no longer carry them" ???? A very nice man came to my rescue though. Ordered a cheese plate for dessert, and it was just dropped in front of us- with no description of any of the cheeses we chose. all the other busboys were very nice, but it was next to impossible to get any service whatsoever while we dined. We went to the bar afterwards, and they had an amazing jazz duo there- and they were spectacular. The admitted to never playing together before, but it was fantastic. Overall, the Old Mill is worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Jo_AnnR155019
Reviews.Content: We went to the Old Mill in Toronto to celebrate our 28th wedding anniversary. Beautiful Spa and Inn with friendly staff, beautiful room and great food and entertainment. Exceeded expectations!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Antonietta I
Reviews.Content: Recently we celebrated our 25th Anniversary at The Old Mill ,we had such a lovely time that we came back a few weeks later for a second stay. Great location, unique hotel and an amazing staff make this a perfect choice to visit whatever the occasion. The rooms are very luxurious and the grounds are enchanting. We enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and then decided to walk the trails. Needless to say the jacuzzi in our room came in very handy after that lenthy hike. We were excited to find out that the Old Mill offers special couples weekends and look forward to try something a little different in the near future. Thank-you to Vaz and staff for your attention to detail, we definitely noticed. We highly recommend the Old Mill for couples who want a quiet oasis in the city.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: rahall
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Old Mill Inn 3-4 nights per visit 5-6 times per year. The staff are superb, accommodations are second to none and I am truly made to feel like a member of the family. It couldn't be better in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding stay”
Reviews.Author: bobzee
Reviews.Content: We had a great time - the staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a great time at our daughter's wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Urban respite”
Reviews.Author: curiousbean
Reviews.Content: Recently had the wonderful experience fo staying at this lovely hotel while in the city on business. It is truly an Urban Oasis, rooms are well appointed and luxurious, staff are ++ professional and pleasant. The place is full of ambiance, very convenient for travelling through the city. Will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Golferboy18
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here recently and I golfed at nearby courses and my wife could take the Bloor St subway anywhere downtown. Most importantly we could then walk to any number of good restaurants in the evening. After dinner we could sit outside in their garden and have a drink and a cigar. The rooms were very nice and well above standard for the price. Breakfast was included and my wife loved the smoked salmon with capers and cream cheese on a special bread. We ate twice in the bar and were well served and my wife loved her trout dinner one night.. Free parking across the street was really helpful. We ate at Dr. Generosity and Vibo and they were both excellent choices. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay. Tasteful, convenient to subway, Bloor West Village, Humber River and parklands”
Reviews.Author: Vernon R
Reviews.Content: Staff were courteous and friendly, room was on the small side but comfortable, Terrace Continental breakfast - excellent. We used to live in the area and so it is good to come back and stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing almost”
Reviews.Author: Coolio211
Reviews.Content: Went here for a one year anniversary surprise for my girlfriend and my expectation were exceeded emtirely!! The preplanning assitance with the front line staff was top notch and they went beyond the call of duty ! We had treatments at the spa that were fantastic and the suite was "sick" aka unbelievable ! There is no point saying more, as its all 5 star all way here! Hope i get the chance to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quaint, relaxing....”
Reviews.Author: globalbouncer
Reviews.Content: Just had a super nice stay at the Old Mill- got there early and was able to check-in early. The room was very spacious and nicely decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable. I enjoyed the windows that opened- turned off the a/c and had some fresh air and a nice view with lots of trees. I was there on a Sunday so had the family dinner buffet which was great and had a nice selection of food- cheeses, salads, seafood (incl. lobster!), soups, hot food- prime rib + lamb, desserts, etc. Free continental breakfast was good- cereals, pastries, fruit salad, yogurt....the normal stuff you'd expect! Overall, thoroughly enjoyed my stay there and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and comfortable room - problem with complimentary breakfast”
Reviews.Author: J H
Reviews.Content: We were on an anniversary trip and loved the room and view. A complimentary continental breakfast was included in our room rate and we deicided to have this delivered to our room instead of going to the terrace. It was clear there would be a delivery fee for the order. We ended up being charged for the breakfast and when I questionned this on my bill, it was explained to me that the complimentary breakfast is actually rolled into the room rate and when we asked for it to be delivered to our room it became a room service order and was no longer complimentary. I felt that I was then paying for the :complimentary" breakfast that was part of my room rate and then paying for that breakfast again as a room service order and then paying the delivery fee to have it sent to my room. That I received no satisfaction upon check-out affected our otherwise pleasant evening.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious and relaxing get-a-way on the banks of the river and the edge of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Wellschiropractic
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the Old Mill, I was greeted by beautiful grounds and an elegant foyer. I was impressed by the front desk staff who were extremely friendly, helpful and efficient during both the check-in and check-out processes. My room was elegant, warm and inviting and best of all the bed- including the pillows and linens were extremely comfortable! My pedicure in the spa was very relaxing and beautifully done. The food, especially the continental breakfast was decadent and the quality was excellent. I don't have a negative thing to say about my stay! It was a really enjoyable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Boring boring boring, not wheelchair friendly VERY expensive eating”
Reviews.Author: shatsky
Reviews.Content: Arrived early, promised early checkin BUT room not ready. Informed staff at booking that my mom was in a wheelchair, but the Inn is (for the most part) NOT wheelchair friendly. The spa was terrific, but there are no diversions within walking distance. Room was large and clean. The meals were narrow and expemsive. Dinner was a fortune, lunch was a buffet and in August had no bananas, and no blueberries and no toast. I had the staff ferret out two pieces of toast and the cost was 33.00 per person. No flexabilty to accomodate even the smallest of requests.Staff was doing their job, got a smile, but that was it. Cant even get to the Humber river, the only diversion on the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: geoffroy2011
Reviews.Content: We were married at the Old Mill 30 years ago. It has charm and personality. The Escape package was awesome with the added bike and kayak rentals. Allowed us to discover more of the surrounding area. The food was very tasty and the front desk staff very accommodating. The grounds were romantic. The upgrade to Luxory King Suite was Amazing. We felt like we were Newlyweds all over again. Nothing but the BEST.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect mini honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: MrsGillis
Reviews.Content: Amazingly comfortable rooms and beds! Gorgeous decor, spa treatments were amazing! (hot stone massage, gentlemens facial, 1/2 hour registered massage and souffle body wrap) Beautiful, relaxing grounds, the perfectly helpful friendly staff! A great escape for our mini-moon!

Reviews.Title: “was amazed with everything”
Reviews.Author: homeRodney
Reviews.Content: your hospitality was excellant, your receptionist went out of her way to get me a curling iron, i come from a small town and you made me feel very welcomed, your meals were very impressive, your rooms are beautiful, again our stay felt like royalty. it was a treat coming here for a wedding. my son and his fiancee picked a beautiful place to have their wedding. everything was amazing. a lot of our guests that were invited to this wedding said they will come back here for a private getaway. You did an awesome job. Thank you Mary Ann Lupsor

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for any occasion.”
Reviews.Author: myacct_britnell1
Reviews.Content: The staff were so professional, courteous and very efficient. Everyone was so pleasant and extremely helpful. I didn't see many of the staff names but the lady who sewed up my daughter's shrug was so sweet to do that. The rooms were very inviting and so private. The inn is truly in a spot where you don't even realize you're just off Bloor Street. So peaceful and quiet. If I lived in Toronto, I would be back for weekend getaways and special family occasions. However, when I do return I wouldn't hesitate to stay there. The continental breakfast was fresh, tasty and there was lots to eat. Seasonal fruits, breads, juices, cheeses, saumon, cereals, coffee and tea or you would order directly from the menu, the choice was yours. Superb. Well done to all the staff. You should all be very proud of the service to you provide.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and delightful!”
Reviews.Author: blue_skysunshine
Reviews.Content: Every Christmas I am a plus-1 at a work event at the Old Mill. We stay over the night of the event and have breakfast at the Old Mill, as well. It is always a treat and a highlight of the Christmas season! Staff is helpful and responsive to any request, the food is always incredibly delicious and the rooms are gorgeous. I also have wonderful memories of family dinners at the Old Mill; the restaurant and dancing area were a favourite with my grandparents and are a favourite for my Dad, so I've been going there ever since I was a small child! We always went (and go) when big band music is playing, and it is really fantastic. The Old Mill is expensive and if you can afford it, it is worth it! I always have a wonderful time at the Old Mill.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Spot”
Reviews.Author: debnding
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here - the first night was in a Garden Room that was quite dark - so when we returned 2 days later, we moved to another room. Only comment would be that rooms could use more lighting.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: Taradc
Reviews.Content: I think this is one of THE nicest hotels I have stayed at! A wonderful wooded escape in the heart of the city. The rooms were superb. Each having an all season fireplace, 2 person deep soaker tub, the best mattress and pillows ever. Upon arriving the room was spotless and inviting with a lovely jazz station playing in the room. The room its self was in beautiful decor overlooking a fabulous woods. The courtyard was the best part. Like being hidden away in the courtyard of some caslte amidst waterfalls and chirping birds. The lunch buffet was decadent. Truly enjoyed renting bikes and pedalling along the humber river. However, the hotel fell down abruptly with their summerlicious menu. Incredibly silly, small portions and the salmon was rock hard with zero flavour. Also, we paid $17.00 for a double rye and coke that had little rye in it! But on the whole, it was a wonderful experience and I will definately go back...with my own bottle of rye!

Reviews.Title: “Its wonderful - I will be back”
Reviews.Author: Princess134
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one week for business in Toronto und I like this place very much. The facility, the room, the breakfast - all areas are absolutely great.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel with modern amenities but an old world charm”
Reviews.Author: jola90
Reviews.Content: The Tudor style with the large room, graceful furnishings and every amenity was quite enveloping from the moment we opened our hotel room door We have already recommended this hotel to all our friends via our email diary of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Our new "spot" away from home”
Reviews.Author: EHWToronto
Reviews.Content: I took my wife here this past weekend for our anniversary and stayed in the King room. From the moment we walked into the room, we knew it would be an amazing stay. The music was already playing and the atmosphere was incredible. Everything from the room decor to all the little details was amazing. The bed was comfy, and the room was perfect. We ordered room service and the desserts were delicious, service was quick and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The next morning we had the continental breakfast, and it certainly didn't feel like the typical ones you get in a hotel. The food was fresh and tasty. My wife and I will definitely be returning, this time for 2 nights. It's our new "place" away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kat0627
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was beautiful. It was larger than most rooms at other hotels with an electric fireplace, loveseat, desk, bed and oversized bathroom. There was a Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom as well as a stand up shower. The bed was quite comfortable. I would highly recommend this place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “While in Toronto I would not stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: advise97
Reviews.Content: The friendly helpful staff helped make this a fairy tale wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great place for a conference”
Reviews.Author: MichelleNSam
Reviews.Content: I was here on business, and the facilities for the conference I attended were great. Service was also professional and efficient. For a buseinss outing, the hotel is great. I stayed in a basic room, which was comfortable with a jacuzzi tub, big fluffy bed and a good desk to work at. The pub fare was good, and the atmosphere nice. I didn't have a chance to check out the spa. No complaints. It seemed like the hotel's specialty was events - conferences, weddings, etc. - and everything is very geared towards that. I'd stay here again for business or for an event. For personal travel, it was a bit far from the city and lacked the warmth I would choose, and of course no swimming pool as they are too close to the river.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic 50th Anniversary Celebration Thanks to the Old Mill”
Reviews.Author: stjohn123
Reviews.Content: The family came from all over Canada to the Old Mill for my parent's 50th wedding anniversary. I can't say enough about the great service. From getting my brother into his room early so he could recover from his red-eye flight, to arranging transport and helping out whenever we needed it, the service was gracious, prompt and friendly. The rooms are fantastic, the beds are comfortable and the dining areas spotless. There was nothing to criticize when it came to the food - it was great. Lots of sitting areas to chat away...if you are looking for a place to enjoy some civilized grown-up time, this is the place. Just a great, relaxing three nights.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful getaway to remember”
Reviews.Author: Deancon
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend here for thier one night getaway package to porpose to her. The staff was wonderful, we got an upgrade to our room. The staff did thier best to accomodate every request we had while we were there. I am very critical of service but the service here by the staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Travellers015
Reviews.Content: An oasis in the city. The area the Inn is located is so peaceful & quiet you would barely know the city was so close. We were celebrating a birthday & the management graciously upgraded our room to a suite. It was very much appreciated. The room was so charming & the bed was very comfortable. Our dinner was excellent & the entertainment was very enjoyable. The complimentary continental breakfast in the Terrace Restaurant was very tasty. All of the staff were very nice and accommodating. We can only imagine how beautiful this Inn would be when the trees & flowers are in full bloom. We plan to return to see.

Reviews.Title: “GIRLS GREAT ESCAPE WEEKEND”
Reviews.Author: elizabethMisissauga
Reviews.Content: Did the girls Great Escape Weekend what a fantastic time we had. We cannot wait until the next one. Great value beautiful rooms. The food was beautifully presented and very tasty. Loved the spa. What a wonderful way to end the weekend. Natalie did an amazing job. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: baileym80
Reviews.Content: Our stay was comfortable and relaxing. Staff was accommodating and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of Europe in the heart of Toronto...An amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: FPPA
Reviews.Content: What a terrific place to stay in Toronto - The Old Mill Inn has the character of a castle, the amenities and conveniences of a modern hotel and you're treated like royalty - What more could you ask for? They truly went above and beyond my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fennerson
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Old Mill for a wedding and we really enjoyed ourselves. The room was lovely and by far the cleanest I have ever seen in any of the places we have stayed over the years. The Inn is quite large so it doesn't really feel very "homey", but rather more like a hotel. The hallways can get quite busy from the late afternoon into the evening with multiple weddings occuring simultaneously. The staff were very polite and accomodating and they seemed to really enjoy their jobs. The fireplaces in the rooms are a nice touch. The only thing that I found to be a little lacking was the view in our room. We were in a garden suite and when we opened the windows, we saw dead plants and garbage. It's Canada and it's winter so there isn't much you can do to beautify, but the gardens should be cleaned of litter at least. I would recommend the Inn for a nice romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING PEOPLE & SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: nbrowne2611
Reviews.Content: While this place is usually out of our price range we splurged for a special occasionand didnt regret one dime.. The jazz pianist in the home smith bar was one of the best i have ever heard. They upgraded our room for no added charged and the staff went out of their way to accomodate all our needs right down to finding and ice bucket & champagne glasses for us. the room was beautiful and incredibly comfortable, especially the bed. All the little extras like lots of towels & wonderful shampoo etc made the stay a dream.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, style and incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tango9R
Reviews.Content: We booked our upcoming May wedding here based upon word of mouth and the Hotel's website. Our overnight was to check it out, meet the catering staff and minister for planning purposes and to just relax. We were not in anyway dissappointed: in fact everything well exceeded our expectations. The Mill is a bit 'sprawling' as it has been rebuilt and expanded to accommodate its current use. The staff were all phenomenal, friendly and helpful. From the reception, through to the catering staff, no one could have been more pleasant. All made us feel as though they truly cared that we should have a great time and were willing to provide friendly directions if we appeared lost. We did not dine in the main restaurant, but had Speckled Trout in the Home Smith bar, primarily to hear the jazz trio since the main room had a 'tribute' style band. I'm sure that they were fine, but just not we were looking for on our Friday evening. The meal was very good, right sized with some very fresh veggies. The cheese tray as savoury to finish off was wonderful and, I thought, a great deal (not that we were looking for 'deals' here) artfully presented with lots of fresh bread slices and flatbread wedges. We booked a Deluxe King Room but were toured through the Luxury King Suite at our request, since we have booked this for our wedding. So nice was it that we decided to extend our stay on the wedding weekend in the suite. The only drawback (and to be sure there is nothing the Hotel can do about this) is that, given the topography and former use of the Hotel as a mill, this was not a pretty time to visit: some areas flooded, difficult to clean up the flotsum and jetsum and pointless to do so given the spring ebb and flow that is bound to occur from the river. Clearly, there are less expensive places to stay, but as a treat The Old Mill Inn is a treat!

Reviews.Title: “The best kept country secret within a busy, hectic city!”
Reviews.Author: swarburton
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were spacious yet cozy,especially watching the snow fall gently outside. The meals were delicious and the waiter that served us was very helpful and patient. We had 6 grandchildren with us so the activity around the table was hectic at time and he just went with it ! We really appreciated his kindness. We all had fun on the dance floor including the little ones. The entertainment was great. The hospitality of the Old Mill Inn was friendly and warm. After finding our way around, it felt like home. Thank you to all the staff for making our 40th anniversary weekend one we will remember for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Elagant Property at the edge of Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Camel140791
Reviews.Content: I just got home from a two day conference at this beautiful property. Everything was professionally done as far as the conference is concerned. The Inn and it's rooms are clean, quiet and very unique. I liked this place so much I plan on returning and bringing my wife along on a get-a-way. My son is also planning his wedding in 2012 and you can bet that I will be recommending that he add this place to his list of possible locations for the wedding and reception. Thank you Old Mill Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Divine - Room, Service and Environment”
Reviews.Author: polishpeacha
Reviews.Content: We checked in with the Sunday treat package. As we had VIP status - we received an upgraded room. It was a King Suite sitting room. Upon entry to our room - the fireplace was on - warm and cozy and a lovely bottle of chilled white wine was waiting for us! The room was immaculate - the bathroom is very luxurious. We went to the Sunday night buffet and the food was sensational. The wine per glass is a little pricy at $11.50 but we enjoyed it all the same. The resort room was extremely quiet. The following morning, we had a continental breakfast in the Terrace. I did have to inquire one of the servers to request a bagel and he was able to retrieve some for the table. It would have been nice to have the servers walk around the room offering coffee more often instead of the patrons having to ask for it. However, once we asked - they were very resonsive. I would definitely return to this location - would like to experience it in the summer time.

Reviews.Title: “Big Country Inn in the City”
Reviews.Author: spmm
Reviews.Content: The Old Mill looks like a very large, Tudor-style country inn, set in an upscale residential neighborhood. There is lots of open space and trees on the property. There's a large, free parking lot directly across the street for the hotel. The king room with sitting area was a good size, with big windows and lots of light. Fresh carpet and furnishings. There was a 32" tube TV and an electric fireplace. The room was on the 5th floor with a view over the parkland around the hotel. It IS in the city though, so one can still see lots of buildings and an elevated subway not far away. The room was clean and quiet with nice linens on the big, 4-post bed. Real closet and an iron & ironing board in there too. The bathroom was really good: Clean with good lighting, big tub, shower stall, separate toilet room with mirror and sink and coffee maker in the counter. Had breakfast delivered to the room and it was good too. There was a table & large desk in the room with CD/radio/MP3 player that had a remote speaker into the bathroom, with individual volume control. Nice touch. There was jazz music in the cozy lobby bar on a Saturday night: Piano, bass and guitar. Good volume. All tables taken. Drinks were on the pricey-side. The Old Mill IS a little expensive, but is well finished and refined...maybe even a little snooty-feeling. I would stay here again, but in a warmer time of year, when there are leaves on all the many trees around. Very good overall.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - great service!”
Reviews.Author: JenOakville
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Old Mill for a friend's wedding. Not only was the event a wonderful success, we really enjoyed our stay at the Inn. Shortly after checking in, someone called to make sure that the room was to our liking. Everything was perfectly clean and welcoming. They even had music playing and the fireplace on for when I arrived - a nice touch! I will definitely look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The quality and ambience draws us back repeatedly”
Reviews.Author: VegVet
Reviews.Content: A great get-away for a romantic night out! Unfortunately the spa service was booked up. Being popular, early booking is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Celebration”
Reviews.Author: WW2Devotee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I married at the Old Mill in 4 years ago in February. We wanted to go back to remember the day by returning and staying over to celebrate our anniversary. It was wonderful. As I walked in the door I could hear light jazz music in the background added an nice touch to the ambiance of the room. The room was lovely and what looked to be very clean. The staff (from the check in desk to the hospitality team) was very nice and warm. Due to our stay we had received a gift certificate that we could use anywhere within the Old Mill. We used that to have lunch in the restaurant and was not dissappointed. It was lovely. The Old Mill has a very unique charm that makes me want to return again and again. I am glad I chose to marry there and I will continue to return to celebrate our anniversaries as well. Thank you Old Mill for making it special.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Inn”
Reviews.Author: JWBM
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Old Mill and Spa. We had a lovely evening with dinner and dancing. The food was wonderful and the service first class. Our room (Suite) was awesome. We had a cozy fireplace to just chill out by and the bedding was to die for. We had breakfast the next day and then a walk around the ground -5 star all the way.

Reviews.Title: “perfect one day getaway”
Reviews.Author: ActonStella
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the Old Mill entertainment package. John Sherwood plays jazz piano every Thursday night at the Home Smith bar.

Reviews.Title: “A little country in the middle of the city.”
Reviews.Author: sharcraig
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend The Old Mill. It is a great getaway with a comfortable relaxed feeling. Our room was very well appointed and the dinner was very good. Having entertainment and dancing just added to the experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We are looking forward to our next visit already.

Reviews.Title: “Tastefully done”
Reviews.Author: jacquit55
Reviews.Content: It has been years since I have been to the old mill and years since I ate in the dining room at the old mill. The addition is beautiful and tasefully done. The spa was delicious and the staff terrific! Bring your dancing shoes as the dining room is wonderful and the couples that danced were even more delicious. Not sure if I enjoyed the menu (Winterlicious) however it seemed acceptable. Value - not sure if I can justify the price for what was offered in the room.
