It appeared a little pricey but the Luxury King Suite is what was expected. Would definitely do it again, my date for the evening was delighted the same. Thank you for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....relaxing...cosy....loved it!”
Reviews.Author: member2011
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel. Stayed there for Christmas 2010 with family (various age-groups) and all thoroughly enjoyed it and left relaxed. We all wished we could stay longer. The rooms were spacious and the hotel has a cosy yet luxurious feel to it. Unfortunately the spa was closed but I've heard great things about it. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: rrats
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, our stay exceeded our expectations. All the staff that we came in contact with were concerned that we had everything we needed, that our stay was the best it could be.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant but very comfortable and cozy...classy!!”
Reviews.Author: causia
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived in the area, I was taken with the residential homes (large & unique). Upon arriving at the Inn, I was impressed by the old world charm. When we entered our room, I was so impressed with the cleanliness, jacuzzi tub, fireplace, stocked bar fridge (extra $), the king size bed with duvet & feather pillows, and all of the amenities. We received a $100. certificate for dinner which was fabulous and it paid for it. Then we danced (what a special addition to our evening). When we returned to our room, the bed was all turned down beautifully with chocolates and the weather forecast for the next day posted on the bed and the ice bucket was replenished (don't know how they knew we left the room, but absolutely a special treat). The next morning after a fabulous sleep in the cozy bed, we enjoyed a continental breakfast that was awesome. Not just the basics that are usually provided, but very healthy fare and gourmet style with lox, various cream cheeses & other gourmet cheeses, bagels, sweet rolls, croissants, fruit, healthy cereals with special additions (seeds, banana chips, etc.), We enjoyed it very much!!! We then went back to our room as we didn't have to check out until 12:00 noon & we wanted to enjoy every minute. The jacuzzi tub offered us a wonderful ending to our stay!!!! We don't have a comparison (except in the Caribbean) of a more delightful time. We have already recommended this Inn to various friends. If you want to go on a short retreat and be pampered, we would definitely recommend The Old Mill & Spa. It was exactly what we needed & we didn't even utilize the wonderful spa services available...

Reviews.Title: “WOW, what a fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: emilymb
Reviews.Content: Our overnight get away package was better than I ever could have imagined. The front desk check in was so helpful with parking and making sure we got our dinner reservation time changed. Dinner was scrumptious, band and dancing wonderful. The room was amazing, fireplace, whirlpool tub, stereo playing soft music and the bed so divine. We will definitely be back to celebrate our 30th anniversary in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, well-organised hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacqand
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious, attractive and cozy. The staff is friendly and the hotel is very well-organised for weddings. The hotel public spaces are lovely, particularly the Jazz bar. Fireplaces are everywhere. The photos on the website make the hotel look dated and stuffy and hotel management would do well to hire a better photographer and update the site. This is a very pretty hotel. The booking and rates are not well-organised. 3 friends making reservations for the same period of time received three different rates. I was told I was receiving the special, which was untrue. We were there for a wedding and the bride had to speak to hotel management to get all of our rooms rebooked with the proper rate. The biggest dissappointment was no free wifi. This is very inconvenient for travellers needing to make make further travel plans. For the price of the room they should up their game and go wireless. Cheaper hotels have no problem with this.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Torontotraveller0
Reviews.Content: I liked the beds, the architecture, staff were very friendly and the breakfast was awesome. I also liked the hot tube and it was good to enjoy a nice bath with my girlfriend!

Reviews.Title: “Charm and great service”
Reviews.Author: yearnin-2-travel
Reviews.Content: I went to a conference at the old mill. Unfortunately I was unable to stay over, but the conference rooms were excellent. Food and service was very good. Facility is a lilttle dated, but very charming. This is a popular place with Torontonians for special events and weddings. I would have loved to have tried the spa, but it was closed when i was here. I have heard from a colleague that their afternoon tea is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Wedding Day”
Reviews.Author: Kisses99
Reviews.Content: We chose the Old Mill for our wedding because of the character and ambiance of this location. From the Bridal Suite to our Candlelight Wedding Ceremony to our Pictures on the grounds and finally our reception, it was PERFECT! Perfect from Start to finish All staff that I had the pleasure of dealing with made my and our experiences unforgetable. Many thanks to all the staff of The Old Mill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but for the price expected better service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: donnanview
Reviews.Content: Booked rooms for spouse and kids as we were at the hotel for Sister's wedding. Requested rooms to put luggage in booked two rooms just asked for one before Wedding at 4:00 but they weren't ready and had to make two three trips across the compound in high heels to finally get keys. Asked that the mini bar key not be left in kids room but it was. Just generally felt the service was apathetic.

Reviews.Title: “What's with the 4:00 check in time when you have Weddings and function at roughly the same time? Who's the customer?”
Reviews.Author: BobbyTehya
Reviews.Content: Having to change in a wheelchair washroom for a wedding is not suitable, if the mill cannot allow early entry to a room the make space to change in that is appropriate. This would lessen the pain of billing the entire amount of the stay a week early. The Mill takes you money then does not assist with accommodation. The mill is a nice place but just saying it is your policy to bill a week in advance then not have any appropriate place to change is laughable and very unprofessional. The room had candy wrappers and a water bottle cap on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TandF
Reviews.Content: Brides who are considering this hotel as a wedding destination may want to pay special attention to the experience we just had at the Old Mill. We booked the Old Mill because a family member was getting married there and although the price quoted seemed rather high, we thought it would be worth it to stay on-site of the wedding and wedding reception. Five other rooms were also booked by other family members and we were shocked to find out that we were quoted a price that was $100 more than what they were given for the same room. Of course, we called the hotel and only after a number of phone calls and emails, we too were given that rate but it was made clear to us that there would be no other bookings at that rate. My advice to brides--to avoid angry wedding guests, make sure that all guests will be given the same room rate. We also had another issue: early check-in and the availability of rooms. Because we were coming from out of town, we requested an early check in so we could get changed. We were told to call the day before so we did. That person said she had noted the request but couldn't guarantee anything but to call back on the day of the wedding at noon. We did that and were told that we wouldn't be able to get into our rooms early. So, we arrived at the Old Mill 2 hours before the wedding and sat in the lobby waiting for a room--they had told us they would call us when the room was ready. In the meantime while we were sitting in the lobby, other family members came and were able to check in. We kept waiting and eventually had to leave to go to the wedding (not looking our "wedding best"). Apparently rooms are pre-assigned and if your room is ready, then you can check in. If it is not, too bad. Okay, but for guests who are arriving from out of town for a wedding and wedding reception that is being held on site, wouldn't best practice be to check people in to rooms that are ready rather than making them wait for a specific room that might not be ready for hours? Again, brides, you might want to consider discussing this policy as out-of-town guests appreciate being able to freshen up before attending the wedding ceremony. All in all, our stay was disappointing and these issues really put a damper on a fun, family wedding weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The Old Mill is always a beautiful stay for us with fantastic service every time!”
Reviews.Author: MGCTLL
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Old Mill a number of times on special occasions and for New Year's celebrations. No matter what the time of year or reason for our visit, the stay is always superb. The room is always pristine and elegant, comfortable, and well serviced. The dining facilities are excellent and we recently attended their Thanksgiving dinner buffet with the same fantastic results. No matter how busy they are (and the buffet was very well attended), the attention, smiles, and caring are a constant and welcome feature. We have also had spa services a number of times and have enjoyed them immensely as well. Bottom line - we will be going to the Old Mill for many years to come - no matter what the occasion and even if we have no particular celebration, they will always make our stay special and memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Away...in the city”
Reviews.Author: ATRT
Reviews.Content: Arrived to attend a professional development program in my industry. The room for our conference was perfect in size for our group with washrooms and break areas close by. The food at every break and meal was excellent., Although not always hot (as you can expect when in a buffet that is waiting for us to finish) it was still very flavourful. Staff were friendly and helpful. The room was fantastic. Large, comfortable and spotless. Although the brochure said wi-fi was billable, I had no problem getting a free connectiona nd in this day and age, that is a priority for business meeting locations. My only complain was being asked for a $100 deposit on my credit card to cover incidentals. I have travelled around the world and have never been asked for that before. I felt like I was not being trusted. Hotel already had all of my credit card information, so I didn't get why that was necessary. I refused to leae it and was not given much of a hassle, but infutre this policy should be reviewed by hotel. Would consider returning for a special event, birthday, anniversary and do an overnight on the Friday to enjoy dinner and dancing with the nband. Really nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “lovely accommodations and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: evelyn_bolduc
Reviews.Content: The only negative comment I could make would be that I found the carpet had a lot of stains which was not pleasant. I was in room 411 if you would like to check. Other things I noticed are as follows: I would have liked to open my window more than four inches wide but I can understand if they were structured this way to prevent children from falling out the window. A box of Kleenex in the bedroom would have been appreciated instead of always having to go into the bathroom to get one. A listing of restaurants in the area would have been appreciated too with walking distances included and any restaurants that offerred delivery as I was required to study every evening and it was difficult to find a place to eat that was fast One night I went to the dining room to find out that it was full with reservations and had to eat in the bar which was not my preference. I would think that a paying customer staying at the hotel should have been accommodated.

Reviews.Title: “Food "o.k."”
Reviews.Author: joan10_10
Reviews.Content: The food, at expensive prices, at their restaurant, was "o.k." (not more), and the service was below average. At this price, there are other "expensive" restaurants in Toronto where you can get better tasting food and a superior service. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great service! Would stay...”
Reviews.Author: mibye2010
Reviews.Content: Great stay, great service! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dream wedding come true!”
Reviews.Author: Di_Aug2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Old Mill the night before my wedding as well as my wedding night. My suite was an apartment filled with everything you could ask for, and all the hotel staff were excellent and very accomodating. My family travelled over from the UK and all had very positive things to say about their rooms and the staff. The hotel is right next to the Old Mill subway station, which made it easier to get downtown for sightseeing. Whatever you needed was never too much trouble for the Old Mill. I would recommend this hotel and venue for a trip and definately for a wedding. They had 14 weddings that day and I would never have known. Food, Service and Office assistance was amazing. They even created a 4 course meal at the last minute to accomodate a guest with serious food allergies.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: brisasdec252008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Old Mill this past weekend for a wedding and the service and value are way below average. This is one of the most overpriced hotels in Toronto! I would only stay here if attending an event at the Inn. Rooms are overpriced at $300 per night, of average size, and for the cost, you would expect some more perks. At Check-In the clerks seemed too busy to care and just wanted to process you through. I had several bags and dry cleaning and no one offered to help me to my room. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Great”
Reviews.Author: Jame69
Reviews.Content: Just a word GREAT for the service. The hotel is so charming inside and make a big difference from the world of the downtown of Toronto. The service and staff is excellent. Nice location, good room and comfort. I'll stay here again if have chance back to Toronto. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice city getaway”
Reviews.Author: happytravels0228
Reviews.Content: Nice city gateway with all the amenities at your finger tips. Restaurant was able to accommodate a vegetarian diet. The spa was also great!

Reviews.Title: “A charming, peaceful weekend getaway.”
Reviews.Author: elishox
Reviews.Content: A great way to escape the city and find serenity in a cozy inn. If you like history and art, you will find all the walls are covered with interesting artifacts and paintings that give it a very tudor style vibe. It would have been wonderful to have the possibility to access to a computer at some point. I was unsure as to whether or not this was a possibility though.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: BCCWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: I have just enjoyed my third short stay at the Old Mill Inn and, once again, I was treated as both a guest AND a friend. I can't say enough about the overall comfortable ambience of the place and the highest level of service provided. I'll be returning many more times, both for business and pleasure. Keep up the great service!!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: rahall
Reviews.Content: From the courteous greeting at the conciege check-in to the excellent facilities, this is truly a "world class" environment. A lovely cocktail bar, terrific breakfast layout and some of the best trained staff that I have experience in 30+ yrs of business and leisure travel. In my opinion, the finest Inn that Toronto has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm, New World Amenities”
Reviews.Author: rmongoos
Reviews.Content: Once you enter the grounds, you feel that you have been transported to another time and place, yet you are only minutes away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Toronto. The inn is charming and romantic, and the food is first-rate. Saturday night there was a great jazz trio playing in the lounge and Sunday brunch was amazing (although verrrry busy). All the amenities are there for a romantic getaway, a high-tech conference, a wedding, or a relaxing spa date. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Magic and Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: oahVancouver_Bc
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I chose to stay her for our wedding weekend. When we arrived we were upgraded into one of the Inn's most beautiful suites. It took our breath away. And what followed was three days of the best customer service we have EVER experienced - from the front staff, flower shop, restaraunt, and spa. It was magic. We are seasoned travellers having been to New York, Moscow, London, Honolulu, Las Angeles, Rome, Anacapri and Stockholm in the last year alone. The experience at the Old Mill Inn exceeded all of our expectations. This place can compete with the best of the best internationally. My husband and I will make a point of returning to the Inn whenever we are in Toronto. This place is truly magical!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Jacmac19
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for our 20th anniversary celebration. Wow! We were impressed. Everything was perfect. Service, location, room, turn down service is a nice touch, and the continental breakfast was nice too. Really enjoyed ourselves. Entertainment - what fun!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: torontocandy123
Reviews.Content: Our stay was absolutely fantastic- great room, comfortable bed, lovely fireplace, delicious food, great entertainment

Reviews.Title: “FÃ©Ã©rique”
Reviews.Author: bizlady_10
Reviews.Content: In april, the breakfast on the terrace overlooking at the flowering cherry tree, rhododendrons and yellow shrubs is extatic! The gardens makes you want to get married just to be in a dress to be photographed amongs the blooms. The continental breakfast is out of this world, with fresh juicy raspberries, smoked salmon and capers, french flaky pastries, brie and blue cheese, in addition to the usual items. The lunch buffet was well worth its 25 dollars (special with the convention), with food out of this world, I remember especially the seafood table with a cold calimari and muscles salad, the maple syrup bulgur/legumes fruity cold salad, and even the rosÃ© sauce pasta which usually would seem standard, were actually extremely tasty. Bravo to the chefs ! and Bravo to the staff in making all aspects of my stay seamless and impeccable. I will come back for sure for leisure!

Reviews.Title: “night to remember”
Reviews.Author: jewels181720
Reviews.Content: hotel over all very elegant room could have bean cleaner there was a hair curler left on the floor and rug needed vacumed. the dinner was excellent we saw mike cooper and the wise guys 98.1 they are fantastic, big jacuzi tub for two front desk staff very nice gave us early check in would go again

Reviews.Title: “CHFI Oldies Dance at the Old Mill Inn Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Mike999_10
Reviews.Content: The facility is historic, but has been updated to include modern amenities. The staff were very friendly and went to great lengths to ensure that everything that could be done to make this a pleasant stay was. We were very surpsied at some of the options offered, as we had never seen them at other hotles. One like this that stands out was the complimentary bed turn down in preparation for sleeping. The staff came in and prepared the room for sleeping while we were at the dance (turned down the bed, arranged the pillows, left a weather forecast, left chocolates).

Reviews.Title: “Roomy Inn, Out of the Way Location”
Reviews.Author: drgmobile
Reviews.Content: The Old Mill Inn is quite cozy and nice for smallish meetings (the hotel has only 57 rooms). The setting is quite charming, part of the building being originally an old mill that was converted to a restaurant and events site in the early 1900s. The hotel opened in 2001 apparently, and is showing its age in the design of the rooms -- which I found a bit dark. The room I was in was quite large with a beautiful king-sized four poster bed and had an electric fireplace. The bathroom was large but the tile should be replaced with more fitting materials. The hotel's meeting facilities were quite nice and the food was excellent. One complaint is that the hotel's layout can be quite confusing. The gym also is in a basement and is a bit lacking in equipment but did the trick. The hotel's location is both an advantage and a disadvantage -- Etobicoke is between the main airport and downtown and the hotel is located in a quiet residential neighborhood. It is not convenient to downtown. The hotel is a good one for intimate meetings, such as retreats, or weddings.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway Inn, in the heart of Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: KRLsmalltownOntario
Reviews.Content: We so enjoyed our weekend @ the Old Mill Inn. This luxury establishment is right next door to the TTC so the city was easy to access with public transit. A meandering riverside park relaxed us in the evening making us think we were far from a bustling city. The Inn was just what we needed, some pamerping and a unique holiday away from our busy lives.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place but too noisy on Saturday nights”
Reviews.Author: finer_things2010
Reviews.Content: I've spent a few weekends at the Old Mill as it's a wonderful place to go away to, without going out of the city. I love the hotel's charm and the character. The rooms are wonderful. However, it is a wedding factory and the hotel is taken over by a wedding party most weekends. Also, they have live music/DJ on Saturdays at the restaurant and the music is so loud that if your windows are facing anywhere north and/or west, it's impossible to fall asleep. Which is a shame if you go there to spend a quiet weekend away with your partner. Also, the continental breakfast included with the room is quite poor. The coffee tastes horrible and so do the juices from concentrate.

Reviews.Title: “At the Old Mill on business.... wishing I was their for leisure"”
Reviews.Author: Mommabear13
Reviews.Content: Lovely, romantic rooms. I wish I was there for leisure, rather than for a business meeting. It's like being in a castle, and wanting to be the princess. The only one drawback are the stairs. For someone with a bad back, and a briefcase and laptop and binders to carry up 2 flights of stairs was a lttle difficult. But I don't know if there would have been anything you could do....

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: T00muchinf0
Reviews.Content: Once I leave home, I anticipate having to deal with the inconveniences of staying in a hotel, even though I would rather not have to do so. In this case, there were no hidden surprises. I got what I had been led to expect in this instance, and more. Keep up the high standards!

Reviews.Title: “The only place we will stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: OldMillInnTravellers
Reviews.Content: We visit Toronto a few times each year and we will never stay at another hotel or Inn. The Old Mill Inn is just our favourite place to stay and we wish there would be an Old Mill Inn in other cities. We are always greeted warmly by staff who remember us, both at the check in, the restaurant and bar areas. The rooms are beautiful with luxery linens which we have purchased for our home. Each room has a CD Stereo player which we tune into Jazz FM and relax with a glass of wine or in the whirl pool tub. The spa facilities are wonderful. The restaurant beautiful and the continental breakfast is very nice. We often have a drink after pur day and the bar and its staff are very friendly and helpful. The Old Mill Inn is located near Transit stops, and there is easy access to the Gardiner. Free parking is included. In addition, there are trails in the area so we can enjoy a nice walk in the morning. And the Bloor West Village is just down the block with lots of great pubs and restaurants. While each room does have internet access, it is not free and the cost is a little more than we would like to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Best girls weekend ever!”
Reviews.Author: aihadley
Reviews.Content: As always, The Old Mill Inn was a great place to spend a girls weekend. Fantastic food, customer and spa service was amazing. Will absolutely go back, again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling at home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: BCCWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: If you have business in Toronto and don't want to stay at one of those 'brand name but faceless' airport or downtown hotels, you won't do much better than the Old Mill Inn and Spa. Even before you have stepped through the ample front doors, the appeal of the place is immediately apparent, particularly if you like a little piece of Olde England just a 15 minute subway ride from the heart of downtown Toronto. The very professional, friendly staff greet you upon arrival and throughout my stay they were attentive without being overbearing! The suites are excellent and the overall ambiance of the place is superb. I'm going back in May!

Reviews.Title: “What an oasis in the city, with fantastic rooms and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: almostoldguysrule
Reviews.Content: For the money, you would think you arrived in a five-star hotel. But is is more than value ehere. This property is unique, with a natural setting, and an historic building that has obviously been thoroughly renovated. The room and bed were amongst the most comfortable I have stayedin for quite awhile.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: MontrealPRQueen
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a gem from start to finish. Food, lodging and service were A1. The spa was thoroughly enjoyable. We found the room to be exceptional, especially the bed and bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Always A Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: benny_canada2003
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here 8 weekends so far, for the CHFI Oldies Dance with Mike Cooper. We're greeted by name, welcomed back, the rooms are always spotless and comfy. Service is fantastic EVERYwhere, the dining room, the bar, the spa. A delightful cross of being pampered and being treated like family. We always look forward to a relaxing weekend and great food and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: copycait
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I decided to treat ourselves for our anniversary and spend the night at a reputedly "luxurious" hotel in the city in which we live. Our suite cost $500 for the night. I have to say that the room was very clean and the decor was nice enough, although a little faded and dated. The problems really began when I suddenly got a violent case of food poisoning. Just to be clear - the food poisoning was NOT contracted from eating at their restaurant - we had eaten at another establishment. We called down to the front desk to ask if they could bring us something to relieve the nausea and/or pain. They explained that they did not sell any such items at the hotel and that policy forbade them from giving us any medications from someone's personal supply. Fine. The hotel is not really locted near any shops, so we asked if there was a nearby store that sold pharmacy items, but they were very unhelpful and said there was nowhere within walking distance. To make matters worse, room service was shut down for the night and they refused to even send up some tea to help settle my stomache. I'm not usually a demanding customer, but for $500 a night I felt like somebody could have jumped into a car and driven 5 minutes to pick something up, especially considering the fact that we had no car (we take public transit) and that they had absolutely nothing on hand to deal with an emergency that is not all that uncommon. My opinion was sealed the next morning though, when we went down for our free continental breakfast. Stale croissants and warm fruit salad, with a dismal selection of beverages. Not that I was eating yet anyway, but still. I did mention my complaints to the clerk at the front desk while we were checking out. He was sympathetic and courteous, but ultimately I received no apology, discount or special offer for a future stay, which I think is poor business practice, especially considering the amount we paid for the night. My fiancee and I both agree that the building and grounds are lovely, but we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Generally pleased but...”
Reviews.Author: beenthereseenthat
Reviews.Content: My lovely wife and I stayed at the Inn for one night - our 5th anniversary - at the end of July. I booked us a King Room with Sitting Area at a preferred rate $256 net of taxes. The room was very nice, a corner unit on the fourth floor overlooking common area gardens. Very quiet, we liked that some of the windows opened to let fresh air in. The King size bed was a four poster, although the mattress was very soft. The bathroom was very nice with a separate water closet and a whirlpool for two (it filled very quickly); the separate shower was just ok, low pressure. I had ordered some special touches including chocolate covered strawberries, fresh cut flowers, and bath/massage lotion. Everything was in the room as requested. We had tea before check-in in the Terrace restaurant, it was very nice. Ordered room service breakfast, arrived a little late but was complete in accordance with our order. The dining area was perfect for enjoying breakfast. Could not make use of the Spa due to all slots fully booked. A couple of issues: At check-in, I inquired as to whether the value of the complimentary breakfast in the Terrace room could be put against room service and was told that, yes, that was the case. However, upon check-out, I was told that I had to pay the full amount of room service, no credit was available. Not that this would have influenced my decision to order room service, but staff should be aligned on policy. Secondly, I left a couple of articles of clothing in the room at check-out and when contacting Housekeeping, none of my calls have been returned. It was a good experience nonetheless and I would certainly stay there again. Very close to some good stores and restaurants in the Bloor West Village.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kdlToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at The Old Mill in June and we were thrilled with our experience. The Inn is very beautiful and the suite we reserved for our two night stay was really stunning. We were both very pleasantly surprised by just how nice it was. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful and everyone we encountered seemed to be set on ensuring that we had a great experience. Our room was very clean and extremely well maintained. Housekeeping was attentive and able to work around our busy schedule on the day of the wedding. And when we discovered that the speaker knob that controls the music in the bathroom was broken maintenance came and fixed it right away. We were worried that the room might be loud because there are a lot of weddings there every weekend and they also have live bands at their restaurants, but the rooms are far enough away from everything that the noise was hardly noticeable. The catering staff did a fantastic job on our wedding and all of our guests were impressed with the venue and the food. We are still hearing raves about that weeks later. They have a chapel on-site so we were able to have the wedding there, the reception in a room just steps away and take the photos on the lovely grounds. Having it all in one place really helped make the day run smoothly. While we were there we visited the spa and were quite happy with the services we received. Everything ran on schedule and it was clean, quiet and very relaxing. It's a bit more expensive than some of the other spas I have visited, but that's to be expected with this sort of hotel. We ate at The Terrace restaurant one night of our stay and found that the food was really wonderful and the service excellent. The Terrace is a little less pricey then the other restaurant on site, but the quality is still high. The grounds are very pretty and this restaurant looks out on the patio and the fountains, which is nice. They have a continental breakfast buffet for guests in The Terrace each morning and it was very enjoyable. They have breads, cereals, fruit, yogurt etc. It's not a huge selection, but it was tasty and more than adequate. For a romantic getaway, a wedding or a honeymoon I would highly recommend The Old Mill. You definitely feel like you are escaping from the city with the beautiful surroundings and the lovely rooms. We are looking forward to celebrating future anniversaries there.

Reviews.Title: “They promise to 'wow' you and sort of succeed.”
Reviews.Author: AJ&ERtravel
Reviews.Content: It's in all the literature, how they are going to 'wow' you at every level. Make a promise like that and you are sure to fall short. It's a good hotel, a good wedding hotel. We were there as wedding guests for three nights. The ambiance and location are a delight. The place has charm and character. The main dining room for dinner on Thursday, Friday and Saturday was accompanied by entertainment, music and dancing - very exuberant music and entertainment. If you want a quiet dinner this is not for you. We gave it a miss and went to the bar where they also serve meals. Unfortunately, on the same nights they had live jazz, advertised for Friday and Saturday but this week including Thursday. The jazz fans gave you stony stares if you tried to chat or laugh while the groups were playing. The evening food choice was therefore reduced to going out or ordering room service. We had one lunch in the dining room that was so bad on so many levels that they gave it to us for free. 'Wow'. And I might add we are the sort of people who rarely complain. We had a King room, not much of a view, but clean, pleasant and well serviced. It's not the sort of place we would stay again unless attending a wedding. As you might expect it's very busy, the corridors full of guests, flowers, aging aunts, drunken uncles, photographers, pipers and all that you might expect from multiple wedding celebrations. It wasn't an unpleasant experience just a bit too much trumpets and fanfares, even for a rollicking good wedding. 'Wow.'

Reviews.Title: “Maintenance needed”
Reviews.Author: BrandyRelaxing
Reviews.Content: In 2005, my husband and I got married here, and stayed in the most expensive room in the place for the night after we got married. Our experience was amazing, so we thought we'd go back for a bit of a vacation. That was a mistake. The room felt like no maintenance had been done in the 3 years since we had been married. The bed sagged in the middle, the shower head was clogged with calcium, the TV in the bedroom wouldn't turn on, and in general, it wasn't any different than what we had seen 3 years ago. We reported our concerns on our comment card, and the manager called and offered to let us stay there again. After re-assuring us that the beds are guaranteed to last for 20 years and it's only been there for 7 years, so the bed must be fine. Which is stupidity. So needless to say, we won't be taking him up on the offer, and won't be recommending the place to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Spoil yourself, but bring warm socks.”
Reviews.Author: reneedo
Reviews.Content: Last Thursday we stayed at the Old Mill Inn. It's a gorgeous place with lots of history. We booked a Queen room and it was nicer than we even thought it would be. The decor was beautiful and the bed was the most comfortable bed I may have ever slept on. Everything looked clean and tidy. The jacuzzi was great after a tasty bit of room service. The hotel provided bubble bath along with the usual shampoos, etc. Given that we were on the first floor in the dead of winter it was a bit chilly in the room, so I'd suggest bringing warm clothes when staying in January. When we turned up the heat the vents were a bit noisy. I have to mention that I love how the music from the cd player also gets played in the bathroom if you want it to. It was nice to be able to listen to tunes while soaking in the tub. Further note--if you want to hear the music you'll have to turn off the jacuzzi jets. The fact that it was so quiet in our room made us feel like we were miles away from the world. When booking there are various treats you can order and they'll put them in your room before you arrive. A nice way to surprise your spouse for his birthday! When you do arrive and have a look around, you'll receive a call asking how your room is. The service at this place is very professional and worth the price if you want to treat yourself to a cozy get-away. Oh, if you want to have a banquet here, I can vouch that this place is gorgeous. Went to a banquet a while back and it was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Spa Experience”
Reviews.Author: CoopToronto
Reviews.Content: Having enjoyed the Old Mill facility for years, often dining and even hosting our wedding reception there, we've previously frequented their spa facility with satisfaction. Our November 2008 experience however was a disappointing exception. Our RMT greeted us with the comment "glad you've arrived early, I get to go home sooner" and it was downhill from there. Her pinchy massage technique was haphazard, unpleasant and ANYTHING but relaxing. We left feeling more tension than prior to our hour long couples massage session - single worst massage I've ever experienced. In contrast, this past weeks massage at La Peau D'or (27 Queen St, Streetsville) was a pleasant surprise, with extremely responsive & accommodating staff achieving a perfectly relaxing massage experience at a more economical price point.

Reviews.Title: “Ye olde Lovely Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: ladyinspain
Reviews.Content: I feel I have been priviledged to dine, attend weddings and now stay at The Old Mill Inn in TO. I was told by local West End residents that it is truly a special place, long used for family celebrations and occasions. The dining room offers 5 star food in cosy tavern-like rooms. My meals were delicious both from the delux dinner menu and from a bar food menu the next evening! We even danced between courses to a live combo - on a Tuesday evening! Best part was to be able to go upstairs to an immaculate room, fireplace (sort of) and jacuzzi tub. If I had saved time for a spa treatment - the option was there. Not for any wallet - but worth the trip to find it for a special day.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here on our wedding night”
Reviews.Author: TEMS1647
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here for our wedding night. We stayed in a suit. It was nicely decorated. A electric fire place, safe, kitchen table, bed room and spacious bathroom with a separate shower. My Best Men for the wedding prepared in our room and I had previously ordered sandwiches and drinks for the afternoon. They were delivered just as we arrived to my room, and all the food was tasty. I would recommend staying here for a romantic get away. It is relatively close to the airport and the subway line is steps away. The location is not great for exploring down town as it is a bit of a ride away, if you want to be in the action of the city look closer to the core. The only problem I had was when my wife and returned from our wedding (at St. Georges golf and country club) as we entered the room all the sandwiches and â€˜messâ€™ from our lunch was still left in the room. They had delivered room service for us, but failed to clean up from lunch. I had even called down prior to leaving for our wedding to have the dishes removed. I called the front desk, they told me to put it in the hall myself. Now looking back at this situationâ€¦ the look on my wifeâ€™s face was classic, dirty dishes and we just got married. At the time it was not appropriate, but credit to the Old Mill Manager, we had a complementary stay later on around Christmas. All ended ok (Still married and have a kid on the way), and they have had time to improve their service. I would trust that it is now better. Overall I would recommend this as a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect place for a magical wedding”
Reviews.Author: tish the dish
Reviews.Content: Our Daughter had her wedding at The Old Mill on 10th August, what a beautiful place for a wedding. The weather was perfect so the Wedding Ceromony was outside on the patio of the Guildhall Banquet Hall. Everything was wonderful,all the staff were very helpful, the reception was out of this world. So many people contacted us after to say what a wonderful time they had. Thank you Old Mill for making Melanie and Mark's day so perfect it is something that they and my husband and I will always remember. If anyone is looking for that "Special Place" to get married this certainly is it. trisha.phillips@rogers.com Barrie, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful restaurant in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: northerndecorator
Reviews.Content: If you would like a change of scenery and do not want to travel too far I would recommend The Old Mill Inn and Spa. They have recently undergone a major renovation and the guest rooms are beautiful and ideal for a weekend getaway. It is also the perfect place for a romantic dinner or a special occasion. There is a spa on site, as well as a great little gift shop. The popularity of their Thanksgiving and Christmas dinners seems to grow with each year. The grounds are nicely kept and it is so relaxing to take a stroll around the area. Regardless, if a few hours is spent at this location having dinner or if spending a few days there it really is a lovely spot !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Wedding at the Old Mill”
Reviews.Author: PMHToronto
Reviews.Content: I just had my wedding ceremony and reception at The Old Mill and I couldn't have been happier with the way things turned out! The planning was made very easy for us, thanks to the excellent catering staff, especially Sonja Kulevska. We were able to choose a very nice five course Italian menu, which incuded antipasto, dinner, dessert and a late-night sweets table. Also a five-hour open bar was included, although we had to pay for an upgraded beer package for our guests who enjoy less common ales. There's ample free parking and coat-check service for $2/coat. The ceremony was performed by a charming non-denominational minister, Rev. J. Allan Logan, who made the service very personal even though we only met once before the big day. Music was provided by Raymond Gould, the organist, and it was lovely. The chapel at the Old Mill is beautiful by candelight, although a bit dark for photography, and since it's small (seating just about 100 people) it felt very cozy and intimate. The reception was held in the Garden Room, which has access to the photo-friendly grounds. The catering staff provided excellent French service for the meal and were very courteous. The food (what I managed to eat during all the excitement) was very good and our family and friends all raved about it. We stayed in one of the luxury suites on our wedding night, and got a 50% discount because our reception was there. The suite was enormous! There were separate dining and sitting rooms along with a huge bedroom and bathroom, all elegantly decorated. The Inn staff was kind enough to let us check in early and leave late, which was very much appreciated. If you're thinking of getting married at the Old Mill, I highly recommend it. If you're going to attend a function there, you're right to look forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: quentinsf
Reviews.Content: Others have given lots of details, just wanted to add my recommendation. If you want something in the centre of the city, this is not for you - you'll have to go for a high-rise hotel with no personality instead. But if you want a very comfortable and peaceful place with friendly staff and a subway station just around the corner, you can't do better than this! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all my expectations”
Reviews.Author: TaraandJohnny
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Old Mill Inn and Spa for a Business Conference in June and upon arrival, it took my breath away. It was an old building, all done in stone and the hallways lit up by Sconces on the wall. It reminded me of an old castle as most of our meetings were on the third floor, however we could not actually get there from the 3rd floor, we had to go to the 1st floor and take a bunch of different passageways. The room was breathtaking. There was a switch for my fireplace, underneath my big screen TV, which I could watch from my King Size bed. The bathroom was the best feature in my opinion. A two-person jetted tub, a glass shower - all amenities were provided. The staff was incredibly accomodating - treated their guests like loyalty. You could tell what the standards are there. The grounds were kept beautifully. What a great getaway, right in the heart of Toronto. You feel like you're in old country Europe. The only disappointing thing was that I forgot something in my room upon check-out and by the time I flew back and realized it, it was gone. This was my fault of course but I was promised a callback and never received one. When I called again, the housekeeping department told me they saw nothing. This clearly means it was stolen. I guess that is what you get for being careless...

Reviews.Title: “This gem is a little gettaway from the city, in the city”
Reviews.Author: JayPayDay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were actually married at the Old Mill in summer of 2005, as many are (I jokingly referred to it as "The Old Wedding Mill"). Jokes aside, we were so happy with the setting, the service, the ammenities and laid back but refined atmosphere that we hosted a family Christmas party there a little later in the year, staying over an extra day to luxuriate. The short story is, if you're willing to spend a little more for room and board (food, spa and room are on the pricy side), and don't need to be near any specific area of town, I'd recommend the Old Mill 100%. The surrounding neighbourhood and lands are very nice, and as you've likely read the subway train is directly behind the hotel and spa area, a 2 minute walk. The hotel, conference rooms, spa and restaurant are all in ajoined buildings and walking around and looking at all these is very interesting, which you are free to do any time. Conference/Wedding rooms keep to the same period in style but are remarkably and differently decorated. As Toronto residents we've been back for dinner since our last visit and we'll stay there again in future, no doubt about it. It isn't the very finest food I've ever tasted, nor is it the very poshest place I've ever stayed but I galdly trade these for the character Old Mill has. Besides, everything's still quite good. The place "feels" great, even after you've logged some serious hours there over time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the Old Mill. It was like being in the country, but having the convenience of the downtown being right there. The room was larged with king bed and jacuzzi in the bathroom. The service was wonderful. The best part was the spa. The warm stone massage was the best and the atmosphere there was really relaxing. I'd say you're wasting a trip if you miss out on the spa

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: anneablue
Reviews.Content: I have to rave about this hotel! We had recently stayed at the Park Hyatt and it didn't hold a candle to the Old Mill. Our children booked us a room at the Old Mill for our 25th Anniversary. What a stunning place! The room was gorgeous with a two person jacuzzi tub, great stereo system ad an ultra comfortable bed. The neighbourhood is lovely, we took a pleasant walk along the Humber River. The next morning we had brunch in the dining room, it featured lobster, shrimp and lots of delicious goodies. All and all it is a very luxurious place.

Reviews.Title: “A Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is unfortunate that such a wonderful hotel would receive such a bad review from the previous writer. Maybe he is a disgruntled past employee. I would not have discredited his story if it had not been for the flat out lie about the neighborhood. I can tell you from experience that the part about the neighborhood is totally false. The neighborhood is beautiful, upscale and pleasant. I fell in love with the surrounding architecture and I saw many women walking their dogs alone with joyous personas. The Hotel seems to be for couples (there were so many weddings there during our stay), but we went with our two children and we all loved it. The hotel room was simply the best that we had ever experience. The only hotel room that comes close is the Jacuzzi suite at the Luxor in Las Vegas. We only book top-notch hotels everywhere we go and we are avid travelers, but I am usually able to find a good deal on an upsale Hotel. My only issue with the hotel is that it was expensive, but I guess you get what you pay for and they spared no expense with the dÃ©cor of the place. I thought to myself that it had to cost a lot of money to build such a spectacular place. Although I had the experienced of being upgraded to a $1,000 room in South Beach Florida, because of a reservation mishap, I had never spent $400 for a room before. Nevertheless, all things are equal, because it was the best and biggest hotel room we had ever experienced by far.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lovee
Reviews.Content: Only had the pleasure of staying here for 1 night in January 2004 for a work function. Would return in a second. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The ensuite bathroom (very large) is wonderful with a 2 person jacuzzi tub. The complimentary products (shampoo, lotion, etc) are amazing. The meals were great. The bar is very classy. Loved the fact that the bar has a separate enclosed cigar lounge. Only thing that could be improved upon was the temperature of the boardrooms... it was either far too warm or too chilly. Can't wait to treat myself to a room at the Old Mill once again!

HotelInfo.Name: Old Mill Inn & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 21 Old Mill Rd, Toronto, Ontario M8X 1G5, Canada
